author: Staff Reporter
text:
Classroom learning alone will not be sufficient to build a complete personality, but additional skill training especially in understanding one’s own potential is essential to be successful in life, G.Sugumar, Dean, Fisheries College and Research Institute (FCRI), Thoothukudi said at a two-day personality development training programme, which concluded here on Saturday.

He said attitude change is the key to improving one’s personality and the institute was committed to developing communication skills, etiquette and presentation skills which could help graduates for a successful career.

S. Radha, trainer from ‘Smart Series’ Bengaluru in her inaugural address emphasised that the success of the personality development programme depended largely on the trainees and hence urged the students to improve learning skills with an open mind and enthusiasm.

Earlier, C.B.T.Rajagopalasamy, Professor, welcomed the gathering. A total of 76 students of FCRI participated in the training.

R.Jeyashakila, Chair, School of Harvest and Post-Harvest Technology, proposed a vote of thanks.
title: ‘Attitude change, key to improving one’s personality’
